content.description: Same start at Shallow Hal in the cave, but this one heads straight up rather than to the left. Use underclings to work your way over the top of the cave. The moves take you to the left a little bit, but for the most part it goes straight up.
content.location: Start by climbing up to the cave.

content.description: Start straight up to the cave, then left through a crack and some underclings. Then over to a pretty good jug. Tough cross, and finish. Watch for loose rock.
content.location: Obvious start right at the cave, move left of the cave as much as possible, then work your way up.

content.description: There is a small boulder on the creek that offers a few lines which range from V3 to V4. Falling while on the boulder results in getting wet. The water is about waist high, so it's not too bad of a fall. This is best done in the summer or late spring when the weather is warmest. This park is a little off the beaten path, so crowds aren't an issue. The problems start at the base of the rock in the water near a small cave.
